definition: (lit.) to fall from a horse/(fig.) to suffer a setback/to come a cropper/to be sacked (e.g. for corruption)
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
lit. to be struck by an arrow and fall from one's horse/to suffer a serious setback (idiom)
Lok Ma Chau (place in Hong Kong)

sentences.english: I won at the club level but lost the area contest.
sentences.chinese: 我在分会赢得了比赛，但是在区域会阶段却不慎落马。

sentences.english: Mr. Liu is the most senior Chinese official to come under such investigation in years.
sentences.chinese: 他是近年来因腐败问题而落马的最高级别官员。

sentences.english: Extra staff were deployed last night at the Lok Ma Chau and Huanggang checkpoints.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚落马州和皇岗口岸都加派人手。

sentences.english: Rapidly, Zhou Yu managed to rein back, but he was shot in the left rib and fell to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 周瑜急勒马回时，被一弩箭，正射中左肋，翻身落马。

sentences.english: The project starts from Chau Tau terminates at Lok Ma Chau.
sentences.chinese: 本工程由落马洲的洲头火车站开始。

sentences.english: Hastily launched "the Northern Expeditionary Army had" several wars down one after another Lok Ma.
sentences.chinese: 匆匆上马的“北伐军们”几仗下来纷纷落马。

sentences.english: His fall has especially shocked Europe.
Since the beginning of year 2010, the charges against government officers, in particular against high-rank officials, have caused quite a stir.
sentences.chinese: 今年以来，官员尤其是高官频频落马之消息引人注目。

sentences.english: A string of prominent Chinese entrepreneurs have been jailed after running afoul of the law.
sentences.chinese: 一个又一个的中国企业家富豪因与法律的冲突而落马。

definition: lit. to be struck by an arrow and fall from one's horse/to suffer a serious setback (idiom)
Central Commission for Discipline Inspection (CCDI), organization within the CCP which investigates corruption and other wrongdoing among Party cadres/abbr. for 中共中央紀律檢查委員會|中共中央纪律检查委员会
corruption
Bo Xilai (1949-), PRC politician, appointed to the Politburo in 2007, sentenced in 2013 to life imprisonment for corruption and misconduct
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to collapse/to topple over
to meet violent death/to get killed
to transfer/to move to another post
to relieve from office/to sack
to dismount from a horse/(fig.) to abandon (a project)
anti-corruption
Zhou Yongkang (1942-), PRC petroleum engineer and politician
shuanggui, an extralegal system within the CCP for detaining and interrogating cadres who fall from grace
to be decapitated (idiom)
to accept a bribe
to bribe/to give bribes
